attributes.action: Install a shield in the Commons Chamber in memory of Jo Cox MP
attributes.background: Following the sickening murder of Jo Cox MP whilst serving her constituents, Parliament should move to install a shield -like the shield installed for Airey Neave- in the Commons Chamber.

attributes.action: Set up a Commission of Enquiry into the Bromley Housing Transfer of 1993
attributes.background: In 1993 Bromley Borough council tenants were given the unenviable task of choosing between a cash-strapped, cost-cutting council and privatisation of the entire housing stock, apparently for all time. This seems a peculiarly heavy democratic burden for any electorate to bear, especially the poor.

attributes.action: Make cycling on a footway an arrestable offence and raise the fine to £1,000.
attributes.background: It is a criminal offence in England and Wales to cycle on footways such as pavements, walkways and foot bridges. The current penalty for this is a measly £50 fine despite the danger to pedestrians.  Cycling on footways should be arrestable, the fine increased to £1,000 and cycles seized until paid.
attributes.additional_details:
With the popularity of cycling in the UK on the up, the numbers of people regularly committing offences such as cycling on the pavement is also increasing. Research has shown that cyclists now represent almost as much danger to pedestrians as motorists do, that the injuries inflicted can be as damaging and nearly 100 people in the UK are killed by cyclists each year.

Making this offence arrestable and increasing the fine will act as a better deterrent and improve pedestrian safety.

attributes.action: End all UK weapons sales to oppressive regimes.
attributes.background: The UK currently sells large quantities of weapons to countries that the Foreign Office recognises as having poor human rights records, including some that have even been accused of war crimes. Profit and political pandering to these regimes should not outweigh basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.amnesty.org.uk/yemen-conflict-uk-must-stop-selling-arms-saudi-arabia

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/britain-still-arming-israel-despite-fear-weapons-will-be-used-against-gaza-10357621.html

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/28/uk-weapons-sold-countries-poor-human-rights-saudi-arabia?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/08/killer-facts-the-scale-of-the-global-arms-trade/

attributes.action: One copy of the British Bill of Rights for every household.
attributes.background: In anticipation of the UK government's desire to replace the Human Rights act with a British Bill of Rights, it seems vital that every citizen have available to them a hard copy version of the new document thus insuring they can know, with complete transparency, exactly what their rights are.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a long history of enshrining the rights of it's citizens in law, from the Magna Carta in 1215 onwards we actually have a proud history of attempting (if not always succeeding) to insure human rights are protected in law.

In the interests of empowering the people that they should know their rights, and thus aid the government in insuring the public trust it's promise to uphold human rights, giving (not selling) every household a copy of the new document is essential.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers add a braille description of contents on food packaging.
attributes.background: This is a reasonable adjustment that will cost very little and aid people to have further independence.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey's entry into the EU.
attributes.background: Recep Erdoğan's Turkey is a nation of deteriorating rights and authoritarian state harassment. Its GDP is half the EU average. It borders two war-zones. It uses the migrant crisis as blackmail and aggressively seeks prosecution for defamation outside of its borders. NO to Turkey's EU membership.
attributes.additional_details:
FREEDOM HOUSE: https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2016/turkey

AMNESTY: https://www.amnesty.org/en/countries/europe-and-central-asia/turkey/

HUMAN RIGHTS WATCH: https://www.hrw.org/europe/central-asia/turkey

attributes.action: The U.K. To exit Europe and start its own trade federation.
attributes.background: Let's make Britain great again by exiting the EU and starting a new world trade federation. Let us show Europe how it should be done and at the same time make the new trade federation fair for all world nations to join including the developing nations.
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of giving handouts to developing nations let's create a trade federation that gives those nations their respect back and allows their economies to develop and flourish. 

Rule Britainnia!

attributes.action: More funding into Camhs and mental health in the uk
attributes.background: So many young people and adults do not get the care that they need for mental health. Young teens have to be inpatients miles away from there family. This is not fair on the families . There is not enough beds for adults. This is not fair on services . Camhs does not have the funding to help .

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn Bridge tolls.
attributes.background: The government recently announced a cut to the Severn Bridge tolls after the bridges revert to public ownership in 2017.  This is not enough. This tax on trade and the local community should be removed particularly in light of the struggling economies of South Wales and the Forest of Dean.

attributes.action: Removal of discourteous remarks/misdiagnosis from medical records
attributes.background: Too many deaths or extended suffering caused by erroneous comments in medical records. There is also too much focus on psychology as a cop-out diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details:
When the patient is later found to have a serious physical illness, the error and misdiagnosis remains in the medical records, along with any discourteous remarks. 
The patient is not empowered and can't get the entry  removed, only blocked.

attributes.action: No appeals for deportation of illegal immigrants and failed asylum seekers
attributes.background: Too many illegals abscond whilst their appeal is being considered UK Border Force should have the power to remove illegal immigrants

attributes.action: Gather international support to pressure Saudi Arabia to stop funding Wahabbism.
attributes.background: Saudia Arabia has openly funded Wahabbism since the 1970s. Wahabbism is the extremist branch of Islam that promotes terrorism and jihad. This government should seriously rethink its relationship with Saudi Arabia and garner international support to stop the spreading of this destructive ideology.

attributes.action: Include same sex relationships as grounds for divorce under adultery
attributes.background: It seems absurd that a same sex couple can get married but if one of them should stray with a same sex person outside of the marriage adultery cannot be cited as grounds for divorce.
attributes.additional_details:
The same can be said for a traditional marriage where either partner has a relationship outside with a person the same sex as themselves, this isn't recognised as adultery.

This law should be overhauled to state that having sexual relations outside of marriage with any person is adultery.

attributes.action: Remove the words European Union from British passports.
attributes.background: As the country has voted to leave the European Union, we believe that the words European Union should be removed from British passports. Furthermore, we believe that the original black passports should be reinstated as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make south west water improve the water treatment plant in Looe Cornwall
attributes.background: Looe in south east Cornwall has been taken over by the stench of the sewage works, especially west Looe. The odours are repugnant and is putting off holidaymakers. We also lose tourist because sewage is allowed to overflow in heavy rains affecting both the estuary and the water quality on the beach.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for mental health especially in the young
attributes.background: Mental health services have been suffering with cuts year after year, until we are now ultimately in a 'mental health crisis', so many people are suffering and nothing is being done. Our government promised us more funding and we are yet to see the action. Mental health can affect everyone.

attributes.action: Lowering the voting age to 16
attributes.background: We believe that the voting age should be lowered as 16-17 year olds live by the laws created by a government that we have not chosen. We think that this is unfair. We can pick our college subjects that decide our future. So why can't we decide who decides the future of our country?
attributes.additional_details: Research showed that 73% of young people voted to remain in the EU. This suggests that the majority of older people voted to leave. We think that this is unfair, as the repercussions will be felt more by 16-17 year olds as we are beginning to head out into the world of work and our lives will be shaped by the choices of older people. Furthermore, now that we do not get governed by the EU parliament, it is more important than ever that we get a government that we support, not one we get given.

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: The government should prevent the sale of ARM, the biggest and most successful British technology company to the Japanese company Softbank.  With designs used in over 90% of devices, the idea that only another company can support its growth is invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government truly believes in businesses that can compete in the world then it must realise it takes decades to develop companies such as ARM and coming under foreign ownership when not needed is only ultimately strategically beneficial for the foreign company and bad for national self-esteem.  

The sale of ARM will represent the end of real British involvement in any significant way in the ever-growing, ever important technology sector.

attributes.action: more support for parents with mental health, stop removing children
attributes.background: I have borderline personality disorder and because of a relapse and time in hospital, I had my children removed and placed in care. This was meant to be until I got better but they are still not home despite a return to good health and the children begging to be back. I am now fighting for them
attributes.additional_details: Too many children are removed based on a parent having mental health problems. I had mine taken despite social services saying I was a good mum and commending me on my parenting. All assessments have been positive but the psychological report paints a bad picture of people with mental health. How is removing children unless they were physically or sexually abused, benefitting children and their parents? More support in the home is needed for those that can be a good parent with help.

attributes.action: Trident to be removed from Scotland and renewed in England
attributes.background: Trident is not welcome in Scotland and rejected by Scottish MPs, if English MPs vote for the renewal of WMD then it should be done in England and not Scotland where it is heavily opposed.

attributes.action: Create a 'silent shopping hour' for autistic people in supermarket chains.
attributes.background: Autism Spectrum Condition is a developmental disorder that affects 700,000 people in the UK from birth. One type of autism is is over/under sensitivity to senses such as hearing, sight and smell. As a result, many autistic people find it very difficult to shop with lots of noise and flashing lights.
attributes.additional_details: An ASDA branch in Manchester ran a trial of a 'quiet hour' for autistic people, in which they turned off bright lights, loud music, and store announcements. This was very highly supported, and autistic people found it incredibly beneficial for them. We are a National Citizen Service group who have learned a lot about this topic recently, and we want more supermarket branches to create a 'silent hour', in order to make life that little bit easier for people with autism.

attributes.action: Local Council Register all fitness professionals that can practice legitimately
attributes.background: Currently there is no regulation of non qualified fitness professionals from practising without qualifications and insurance. To maintain standards a register of all trading fitness/massage persons working/earning should be controlled by local councils. REPS and CIMSPA can only regulate upon members
attributes.additional_details: Poor quality and lack of knowledge isn't the way forward to providing good exercise prescription. This just simply isn't safe if you are charging the client or giving it for free. If you have no qualifications/experience you can mislead people into thinking you can training healthy people or people with diagnosed medical conditions or injuries or even have no insurance. We must raise the standard of what clients have as a fitness professional and impose some kind of penalty.

attributes.action: The Queen should be asked to stop Art 50 being invoked because of the referendum
attributes.background: In the light of the threat to the integrity of her United Kingdom and the narrowness of the vote, Members of Parliament should request that Her Majesty the Queen use the powers invested in her to ensure that Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty is not invoked on the basis of the June 23rd referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
The narrow victory for Leave in the recent referendum, and the likelihood that initiating Article 50 will lead to the break-up of the United Kingdom, leave the UK in a very difficult position. Political parties are in chaos. 
The Queen has the power to stabilise the United Kingdom and it would help if she were advised to do so by Parliament.

attributes.action:
Outlaw Investor-State Dispute Settlements
(Investors Suing the U.K. Government)
attributes.background: Investor-State Dispute Settlement clauses in trade deals provide a means for foreign investors to sue governments for policies which harm their profits. If successful, taxpayer money is used to pay damages to them. A government can thus be more beholden to corporations than the public they serve.
attributes.additional_details:
The TTIP trade agreement contains one such ISDS clause. The Trans Pacific Partnership (TPP) and Trade In Services Agreement (TISA) have one also. 
Secretly negotiated, they ensure foreign corps are able to sue 2/3 of the world's governments and block trade with the emerging economies of China, Brazil, Russia, India and S. Africa. 
Examples:
Vattenfall vs Germany for phasing out nuclear energy ($3.7bn)
Veolia vs Egypt (introducing a minimum wage)
B.A.T. vs Australia (tobacco advertising laws)

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: Article 50 must be invoked within12 mths following the result of the referendum.
attributes.background: David Cameron has not invoked article 50. In order to stop this or a future government from not respecting the result of the referendum and the wishes of the people of the UK, there must be a rule that Article 50 must be invoked within 12 months of the result of the referendum.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum for British expatriates.
attributes.background:
My family and I (all British Nationals) have lived and worked in France  for the last 25 years.  
The latest EU referendum will have severe repercussions on our future, and we should have the right to participate in the process.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently we can neither vote in UK General Elections nor French Parliamentary or Presidential Elections.  As EU citizens, we can vote in European elections and in French local elections. 
The decision on Britain's continued membership of the EU is of critical importance to us and will have far-reaching consequences for the future of all British nationals living and working in Europe and further afield.

attributes.action: Control the right to vote, by a political knowledge test.
attributes.background:
Voters have no political knowledge to vote fairly.
It is a duty of every voter to know the theory behind every voting and base the opinion and vote on true facts and figures. 
To help the nation understand the politics and consequences of choices, 'right to vote' control is urgently needed.

attributes.action: Reject any Brexit terms that exclude the UK from the Common Market
attributes.background: This petition requires that before invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, HM Government must ensure that, following Brexit, British citizens and firms will continue to have full, unprejudiced access to the European Economic Area.

attributes.action: The World Heritage City of Bath Should Remain within the EU and leave the UK
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU after 43 years. A 57.9% majority of Bath residents voted to remain. There was a turnout of 105,298 in Bath & NE Somerset, that's 77.13%. 60,878 of residents voted to remain. We are a World Heritage City. We want to remain and share that heritage with Europe.

attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at £9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to £20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: Allow a further EU referendum in 2018
attributes.background: We need a further vote.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: Greater independent regulation and oversight throughout buying a new home
attributes.background: Stressful enough, the process of buying a new house is fraught with legal traps and hidden charges for the consumer, where developers have free-reign to act as they please. Just like the majority of other industries, we need a body to provide advice to consumers and help when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Buyers being forced to queue in the freezing cold overnight for the right to reserve a property should not happen in the 21st Century, and neither should waiting almost a year trapped, having legally exchanged contracts, to move in.

Thanks to schemes like help-to-buy it is getting easier for first time buyers to purchase, and new-build properties are the key. The NHBC is there to help when you've moved in, but we need an independent regulating body to help through the process of purchasing.

attributes.action: Make Grooming awareness classes compulsory in year 7 students timetables.
attributes.background: Grooming Gangs target young and vulnerable children.  This is more evident as the scandals are hitting the media headlines, like in Rotherham where 1400 girls were sexually exploited. Ever since more cases have come to light.  Young people need to be educated regarding this ongoing problem.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotherham_child_sexual_exploitation_scandal

attributes.action: Families should only receive benefits & tax credits for their first two children
attributes.background: Why should people be having extensive families if they cannot afford them? Why should the hard-working tax-payer have to fork out for this? Why is there not a barrier on the amount of money provided for each family?
attributes.additional_details: On 7th June on the ITV programme, This Morning a lady was speaking about her 12 children & the £40,000 of benefits that she receives each year, not only this, but her plans for her 13th child. This, alongside many other stories like this one are becoming more regular. Should it be that people having 12 children gain more money through benefits than someone working full-time? There should be a point this is restricted and the choice to have more children is at the families own expense.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: Make councils turn redundant grace space they own into wildflower meadows.
attributes.background: Councils own lot's of patches of land next to roads, buildings  on housing estates etc; all that grows there is grass; it looks boring and the councils probably spend a fortune cutting the grass in the warmer months. Meadows are decreasing they need some help.

attributes.action: Make a commitment to create a British space elevator (not just a space port).
attributes.background: If we truly want to get in to the space race we need to make a bold move. A space elevator would allow for cheap transport into orbit. The material science is close. We have a possible site in the Ascension Islands and we should take the initiative for once. The commercial possibilities are endless
attributes.additional_details:
Space Elevators in Science Fiction, also see Beanstalks

http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/176625-60000-miles-up-geostationary-space-elevator-could-be-built-by-2035-says-new-study

BBC, Wikipedia

attributes.action: MPs should be paid the National Living Wage after regaining control of their pay
attributes.background: Many working people struggle financially on low wages. MPs are currently 'forced' to receive large salaries and pay increases by an independent body.  By reclaiming their right to set their own pay they could set it at the National Living Wage. This would encourage them to work for a fairer society.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane of the UK motorway.
attributes.background: Minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast overtaking lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents that result in serious injuries or even death.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show most accidents on the motorway occur in slow moving traffic.

By introducing a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents. This could save millions of pounds annually.

Enforcement: A speed camera that is programmed to catch out motorists driving below 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways.

Punishment: 3 penalty points and a £100 fine or a short driving test to test their ability to see if they can drive safely at atleast 100mph in the fast lane.

attributes.action: Reconsider the National Insurance banding for public sector employees.
attributes.background: In april 2016 the goverment implemented a rise in the national insurance banding affecting public sector workers including the armed forces, dentists and nurses where the banding has gone from a band D to a band A increasing 1.4% increase NI contributions equating to more than the 1 % payrise given
attributes.additional_details:
The decision for the increase was made in the 2013 budget. Since then the general rate of inflation has already increased

The impact of this rise was felt in receipt  of pay recieved for april where we recieved less than march because of this increase. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pay-awards-for-over-a-million-public-sector-workers

https://www.unison.org.uk/news/press-release/2015/11/unison-says-national-insurance-increase-will-rob-public-sector-workers/

attributes.action: Increase drink driving ban from a minimum of 12 months to a minimum of 24 months
attributes.background: Drink drivers are a bigger threat than terrorists. Some people seem to love taking risks. The majority of the time it's not the drink driver that gets hurt. 3,000 people a year on average are either killed or injured by a drink driver. Take the drink drivers off our streets for longer.

attributes.action: Make the working week 4 days and the weekend 3 days.
attributes.background: I feel we work far too hard as it is and two days is a pitiful reward for five days graft. We should reward ourselves with a three day weekend. After all, life is for living, not working. I propose we add an extra hour in the day for work on the days we work, but take Friday as part of the weekend.

attributes.action: Additional Bank Holiday in October
attributes.background:
From the end of August to the end of December, the UK do not have any bank holidays.
The UK have one of the least amount of Bank Holidays in the world.
I propose an additional Bank Holiday for the UK in between August and December.
attributes.additional_details:
Trafalgar is a popular choice and that was on the 21 October 1805. Nelson died but Britain prevailed. Trafalgar Day has a nice ring.

The Battle of Hastings was fought on the October 14 1066 so could also be around this day
